title: Harry Potter's Dudley Dursley is all grown up! Actor Harry Melling shows off weight loss at new movie premiere
text:
Harry Potter's Dudley Dursley is all grown up! Actor Harry Melling shows off weight loss at new movie premiere The muggle child is well and truly grown up! Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Harry Potter ’s bratty cousin Dudley Dursley is all grown up and looking VERY different to the chubby youngster we all know and love. Or hate, given his character’s rather nasty treatment of poor Harry. 
Actor Harry Melling has everyone talking after hitting the red carpet this weekend looking worlds away from the muggle that made him famous. 
Harry, who was only twelve years old when he appeared in Harry Potter and the Philospher’s Stone, was pictured at the premiere of his new movie The Lost City Of Z. 
How different does he look now! Harry Melling is all grown up! (Photo: WireImage) Dudley with parents Vernon and Petunia Read More Harry Potter's Pansy Parkinson actress Scarlett Byrne poses for Playboy and declares: "Naked is normal" 
Harry, now 27, says his weight loss actually began while the Harry Potter franchise was still filming; he ended up losing so much weight ahead of the final two movies he worried that producers might want to recast his overweight character. 
“They did this double-take, 'Oh my God, we are going to have to do something,' and I felt very guilty,” he told The Telegraph in 2009. “They could have recast, but instead they padded me out." 
He said his weight loss was kick started in 2007 while he was performing at the National Youth Theatre. His character was an old man. He appears in new movie The Lost City Of Z (Photo: Splash News) Dudley with his parents, pictured in The Order of the Phoenix (Photo: Warner Bros) Read More Harry Potter would be proud as teaching children MAGIC could 'improve their education' 
“Before that I had played fat clowns and I thought, 'If I want to have the career I would like, I am going to have to lose weight.' I was just starting drama school, and found I was moving around a lot. I also started to eat sensibly. The weight just dropped off. I went from 16st to 11st 5lb." 
And he added of moving on from Potter: "I can now shed the child-actor thing, like the fat, and start a new career, because no one sees me as Dudley." 
Of course, he’s not the only Harry Potter child actor to have completely changed from his days on the wizarding movie. Matthew Lewis: then and now! (Photo: Instagram / Matthew Lewis, Rex) 
Matthew Lewis, who played bumbling schoolboy-turned-hero Neville Longbottom, frequently wows fans with his new chiselled, svelte physique, while Scarlett Byrne, who played Slytherin schoolgirl Pansy Parkinson, has just posed for Playboy. Like us on Facebook
